definition: to hold/to grasp/to clench (one's fist)/to master/classifier: a handful
to have/there is/there are/to exist/to be

sentences.english: And where had the horsehair come from, which she clutched in her little hand?
sentences.chinese: 而且她在小小的手上握有馬兒的鬃毛，是哪裏來的呢？

sentences.english: You have all the infermation you require to do a bang-up job in Washington.
sentences.chinese: 你握有你需要的可在華盛頓一炮打響的全部材料。

sentences.english: Plato wrote a series of letters that we have.
sentences.chinese: 我們握有柏拉圖所寫的一系列書信。

sentences.english: That's where the big-budget brand advertisers come in.
sentences.chinese: 於是那些握有鉅額廣告預算的品牌出現了。

sentences.english: One puts on gloves before grasping a thorn cudgel.
sentences.chinese: 爲了要握有刺的棍子，首先得戴上手套。

sentences.english: The power elite inside the government is controlling foreign policy.
sentences.chinese: 政府內部的一羣握有實權的精英控制着對外政策。

sentences.english: For instance, the former governor of Yunnan province, Li Jiating, had five passports, all real.
sentences.chinese: 比如，前雲南省省長李嘉廷，實際握有五本護照。

sentences.english: Nor can it allow a parliament to have real power.
sentences.chinese: 他們也不會允許議會握有實權。

sentences.english: Whenit comes to business success, morning people hold the important cards.
sentences.chinese: 當談及工作，早晨類型的人手上握有王牌。

sentences.english: They have just as many weapons and are in control of the rules of engagement.
sentences.chinese: 他們握有同樣多的武器，掌控着警匪間的規則。

sentences.english: The magazine claimed they have pictures, provided by an insider, of the 2 dating.
sentences.chinese: 該雜誌宣稱握有知情人提供的兩人親密合照。

definition: (fig.) to hold in one's hands/to be within grasp
initiative (as in "seize the initiative")/advantageous position that allows one to call the shots
to take back (forcibly)/to recapture/to win back
to covet/to long for/to lust after
to suddenly reveal/to flash (one's ID, a banknote etc)
